Package com.github.cdefgah.bencoder4j.io

Class BencodeStreamReader

java.lang.Object
com.github.cdefgah.bencoder4j.io.BencodeStreamReader
public final class BencodeStreamReader
extends java.lang.Object
Helper class to read input stream to get bencoded objects from it.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    BencodeStreamReader​(java.io.InputStream is)
    Constructs the reader class instance.

  • Method Summary

    int read()
    Reads a byte from the stream.
    int readByteSequence​(byte[] sequence)
    Reads byte sequence and returns the qty of read bytes.
    java.lang.String readCharSequence​(char stopSymbol)
    Gets character sequence until specified symbol.
    void unread​(int byte2Unread)
    Pushes the byte back to the stream.

  • Constructor Details

    • BencodeStreamReader

      public BencodeStreamReader​(java.io.InputStream is)
      Constructs the reader class instance.
      Parameters:
      is - reference to input stream.

  • Method Details

    • read

      public int read() throws java.io.IOException
      Reads a byte from the stream.
      Returns:
      byte from the stream, or -1 if the end of the stream is reached.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there's an I/O error occurred.

    • unread

      public void unread​(int byte2Unread) throws java.io.IOException
      Pushes the byte back to the stream.
      Parameters:
      byte2Unread - byte to be pushed back to the stream.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there's an I/O error occurred.

    • readByteSequence

      public int readByteSequence​(byte[] sequence) throws java.io.IOException
      Reads byte sequence and returns the qty of read bytes.
      Parameters:
      sequence - array to be used as target place upon reading bytes from the stream.
      Returns:
      qty of bytes read, or -1 if the end of the stream has been reached.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there's an input/output error occurred.

    • readCharSequence

      public java.lang.String readCharSequence​(char stopSymbol) throws java.io.IOException, BencodeFormatException
      Gets character sequence until specified symbol. Useful when you need to read all characters until 'e' or until ':'.
      Parameters:
      stopSymbol - stop symbol, not included to the result string.
      Returns:
      string, composes from all read characters.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there's an input/output error occurred upon reading.
      BencodeFormatException - if there's an error related to the bencoding format.
